title: What is the oldest capital city in North America? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Cortez, Colorado. A bit south of Cortez lies Mesa Verde National Park, site of an ancient North American Anasazi city on a grand scale.  This palace was home to the leaders of a culture that existed 1500 years ago. This complex was created over the course of possibly 700 years, between 600–1300 CE. The Anasazi were an advanced culture whose origins begin more than 3000 years ago in what’s today called the Yukon Territory of Canada. The Navajo tribe and the Hopi also trace their origins to the Pacific Northwest and Eskimo cultures. These First Nation tribes studied the sky, creating vast mythology similar to the Greeks and Egyptian Gods. It’s interesting that cultures on opposite sides of the world, isolated from each other by tens of thousands of kilometers could come up with similar stories. The cultures did view the exact same sky though, and we’re all the same human species though, so it makes sense. Anyway, in the palace there are round meeting chambers, used in ceremonies both spiritual and political. We can understand from panel drawings that their government was made up of a triad or duo leadership, as several key figures appear in much of the art.  As you can tell, some Europeans hand no sense of propriety, And graffitied. The oldest drawings are in red, an iron based paint, and the later drawings are carved into the rock by later cultures. We may never know the extent of the older cultures, as modern cultures destroyed much of the record.  And continue to do so.  The greatest shame of Western European culture is apathy to other cultures. Westerners are taught from a young age that “What’s mine is mine, no matter what,” and “if I found it, it’s mine.” This foolish “finders keepers” ideology leads to war and terrible tragedy. And because of ignorance it keeps happening. People just don’t care. As an explorer of ancient cultures, it makes me sad to see this lack of understanding and interest. The modern generation is perverted and not focused on what’s important. Sigh. It’s all been said before. More to consider…

Photo credit: Shoppers gather at an artists market at the Santa Fe Railyard. (Source: 10 Insider Tips for Your Trip to the City Different) Santa Fe, New Mexico. The city came to life in 1607 but wasn't really settled until a few years later by conquistador Don Pedro de Peralta, who was Governor-General in what was then the Spanish “Kingdom of New Mexico.” He moved the capital from its previous location, San Juan Pueblo, to Santa Fe, located just south. This makes it the oldest capital city in North America, and a walk through the city is evidence of this. You’ll find Spanish-Pueblo-style adobe architecture, the Palace of the Governors (America’s oldest public building), as well as the Santa Fe Fiesta (America’s oldest community celebration), which began in 1712 to celebrate the reconquest of New Mexico by Spain.
